revised_title: Sexual Dimorphism and Synaptic Convergence in the Preoptic and Anterior Hypothalamic Areas of the Rat
tldr: The authors conducted electrophysiological experiments on male and female rats to study the preoptic and anterior hypothalamic areas. They found evidence for sexual dimorphism and synaptic convergence in these areas, specifically in neurones projecting to the region of the median eminence. The results showed that many adjacent preoptic/anterior hypothalamic neurones received convergent synaptic inputs from both the mediobasal hypothalamus and the corticomedial amygdala.
